content.text:
Create a clean, calming mobile app planner designed for chronically ill users and busy moms who experience fatigue, brain fog, pain flares, and variable energy levels.

The app should prioritize simplicity, flexibility, and emotional safety over productivity pressure.

Core Concept

This is an energy-based planner, not a time-blocked planner. Users plan their day based on how they feel, not rigid schedules.

Target Users
	•	Chronically ill or disabled adults
	•	Neurodivergent users
	•	Busy moms (especially caregivers of young children)
	•	Users who struggle with brain fog, low stamina, and overwhelm

App Features

1. Daily Check-In (Home Screen)
	•	Simple check-in with:
	•	Energy level (Low / Medium / High)
	•	Symptoms (fatigue, pain, brain fog, dizziness, anxiety — multi-select)
	•	Mood (calm, overwhelmed, hopeful, tired, etc.)
	•	The app adapts recommendations based on this check-in.

2. Energy-Based Task Planning
	•	Tasks are categorized by energy cost, not time:
	•	Low Energy
	•	Medium Energy
	•	High Energy
	•	Tasks can be marked:
	•	“Optional”
	•	“Must do”
	•	“Can wait”
	•	No overdue or red warnings. Missed tasks gently roll over.

3. Admin Mode (Low-Energy Days)
	•	A dedicated Admin Mode for flare days:
	•	Minimal UI
	•	Only shows essential tasks
	•	One-tap completion
	•	Encouraging copy like “You’re doing enough today.”

4. Weekly Overview (Flexible)
	•	Week view that:
	•	Shows energy trends instead of productivity stats
	•	Allows drag-and-drop tasks between days
	•	Includes rest and recovery as valid tasks

5. Gentle Self-Care Section
	•	Optional reminders for:
	•	Hydration
	•	Medications
	•	Rest breaks
	•	Nervous system regulation (breathing, grounding)
	•	These should never feel mandatory.

6. Mom-Friendly Features
	•	Ability to tag tasks as:
	•	“Kid-related”
	•	“Work”
	•	“Self”
	•	Quick-add buttons for:
	•	Appointments
	•	School/daycare notes
	•	Low-energy activities for kids

Design Requirements
	•	Soft, calming color palette (neutral, warm, minimal)
	•	Large readable text
	•	High contrast but gentle visuals
	•	No clutter, no gamification, no streak pressure

Technical Requirements
	•	Build as a cross-platform mobile app (iOS & Android)
	•	Local data storage first (offline friendly)
	•	Simple onboarding with optional tutorial
	•	Editable task templates

Tone & Copy
	•	Compassionate, validating, non-judgmental
	•	Avoid productivity shame language
	•	Examples:
	•	“Rest counts.”
	•	“Progress looks different every day.”
	•	“You’re allowed to go slow.”

Generate the full app structure, screens, basic logic, and navigation flow. Focus on an MVP that is usable immediately.

-   **Daily Check-In (Home Screen):** A simple screen where users can log their energy level (Low/Medium/High), symptoms, and mood. This will be the first screen users see upon opening the app.
-   **Energy-Based Task Planning:** Users can add tasks and categorize them by energy cost (Low, Medium, High). Tasks can be marked as "Optional," "Must do," or "Can wait."
-   **Weekly Overview:** A screen displaying the week's energy trends and allowing users to drag and drop tasks between days.

**Design Elements:**

-   **Colors:**
    -   Background: `#F8F8F8` (Very light gray)
    -   Text: `#333333` (Dark gray)

    -   Primary: `#A7C4BC` (Pastel green)
    -   Secondary: `#E8DDCB` (Beige)

    -   Highlight: `#F2E8CF` (Pale yellow)
-   **Typography:** Use a modern, clean font like "System" for readability. Ensure large, readable text sizes.

**Plan for Code Changes:**

1.  **Project Structure:** The existing project structure will be used, focusing on modifying the `app/(tabs)` directory to implement the core features.
2.  **Home Screen (`app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`):**
    -   Modify the existing home screen to include the Daily Check-In feature. This will involve adding UI elements for energy level selection (Low/Medium/High), symptom selection (fatigue, pain, brain fog, dizziness, anxiety), and mood selection (calm, overwhelmed, hopeful, tired, etc.).
    -   The selections should be stored locally.
    -   The `modalDemos` array should be removed from this file.
3.  **Task Planning Screen (`app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx` and a new file `app/(tabs)/tasks/index.tsx`):**
    -   Create a new screen for Energy-Based Task Planning.
    -   Implement UI elements for adding tasks, categorizing them by energy cost (Low, Medium, High), and marking them as "Optional," "Must do," or "Can wait."
    -   Store tasks locally.
4.  **Weekly Overview Screen (`app/(tabs)/weekly/index.tsx`):**
    -   Create a new screen for the Weekly Overview.
    -   Implement a week view that shows energy trends (this can be a simplified representation initially).
    -   Allow users to drag and drop tasks between days.
5.  **Navigation:**
    -   Modify the tab navigation in `app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx` to include tabs for the Home Screen, Task Planning Screen, and Weekly Overview Screen.
